definition: to run around all over the place
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
(of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: Many boys are running about on the sand beach.
sentences.chinese: 很多男孩在沙灘上亂跑。

sentences.english: Daniel, why are you running about alone?
sentences.chinese: 大牛，你怎麼自己到處亂跑啊？

sentences.english: You could actually get squeezed in by these hedges and you could be chased around.
sentences.chinese: 你很可能被那些樊籬夾扁的，被擠到四處亂跑的。

sentences.english: Pound the cows so they don't stray.
sentences.chinese: 把這些走失的牛關進待領場，這樣它們就不會亂跑了。

sentences.english: But mad dogs and Englishmen go out in the midday sun.
sentences.chinese: 只有狗和英國人才在中午的太陽底下在外面亂跑。

sentences.english: In fact she can bound across a room at a surprisingly break-neck pace.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，她在房間裏撒歡亂跑的速度簡直令人喫驚。

sentences.english: They were as fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour's wife.
sentences.chinese: 他們像餵飽的馬到處亂跑，各向他鄰舍的妻發嘶聲。

sentences.english: Who tries to tell liu, let him not to run after.
sentences.chinese: 樂兒告訴劉盈，讓他以後不要亂跑。

sentences.english: The dog, an ungainly mongrel pup , was loping about the road.
sentences.chinese: 那隻醜陋的雜種幼犬在馬路上到處亂跑。

sentences.english: The old man was romping in the courtyard with his grandsons.
sentences.chinese: 這位老人在院子裏與他的孫子們亂跑亂叫地耍鬧。

sentences.english: He allows his children to run wild.
sentences.chinese: 他聽任孩子們亂跑亂鬧，不加管束。

sentences.english: The startled horse charged about blindly, upsetting a row of ped1ars' stalls AT the side of the street.
sentences.chinese: 那匹驚馬一個勁亂跑，把街旁一排小販的貨攤撞翻了。

sentences.english: I suppose it's better than letting them run loose around town!
sentences.chinese: 那總比讓它們在城裏亂跑好吧。

sentences.english: So there's tons of dogs and animals running around in the daytime.
sentences.chinese: 所以在白天，有很多狗和其他動物到處亂跑。

sentences.english: You run about, my little Maid.
sentences.chinese: 我的小姑娘，你能到處亂跑。

sentences.english: We could hear the mice scurrying about in the walls.
sentences.chinese: 我們能聽到老鼠在牆裏亂跑。

definition: to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to lose face/humiliation
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
to make an unreasonable scene
to act recklessly/to mess around
to talk nonsense/nonsense!
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
(coll.) a moment/a while
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
startled
